articles.author: ZEKE MILLER, JOEY CAPPELLETTI and SEUNG MIN KIM
articles.description: DETROIT (AP) — President Joe Biden on Friday forcefully defied the growing number of critics in his own party who have called on him to exit the race, pivoting to warnings about a second Donald Trump term and declaring he was “not done yet.”
articles.title: In 'blue wall' push, Biden defiantly says he's 'not going anywhere' as he slams Trump, Project 2025

articles.author: BILL BARROW
articles.description: For all the usual stagecraft, the Republican National Convention that opens Monday is different from Donald Trump's previous nominating affairs.
articles.title: Republicans are gathering in Milwaukee to nominate Donald Trump again. Here's what to expect

articles.author: MORGAN LEE and ANDREW DALTON
articles.description: SANTA FE, N.M. (AP) — A New Mexico judge on Friday brought a sudden and stunning end to the involuntary manslaughter case against Alec Baldwin, dismissing it in the middle of the actor's trial and saying it cannot be filed again.
articles.title: Alec Baldwin weeps in court as judge announces involuntary manslaughter case is dismissed midtrial

articles.description: LOS ANGELES (AP) — A New Mexico judge dismissed the involuntary manslaughter case against Alec Baldwin over the fatal shooting of cinematographer Halyna Hutchins in a sudden move Friday.
articles.title: What’s next for Alec Baldwin after involuntary manslaughter case dismissal

articles.author: LISA MASCARO
articles.description: WASHINGTON (AP) — Nancy Pelosi’s phone lit up the night of President Joe Biden’s debate performance with a question that has yet to be fully resolved: Now what?
articles.title: Pelosi and Democratic leaders try to guide their party through Biden uproar

articles.author: MICHAEL R. SISAK
articles.description: NEW YORK (AP) — A judge threw out Rudy Giuliani ’s bankruptcy case on Friday, slamming the former New York City mayor as a “recalcitrant debtor” who thumbed his nose at the process while seeking to shield himself from a $148 million defamation judgment and other debts.
articles.title: Judge ends Rudy Giuliani bankruptcy case, says he flouted the process with his lack of transparency

articles.author: BRENDAN FARRINGTON
articles.description: Here's a troubling phrase hurricane forecasters hate but often hear: “It's just a Category 1. Nothing to worry about.”Or even worse: “Tropical storm? Just some wind and rain.”But look at Hurricane Beryl, which hit Texas this week as a “mere” Category 1 storm — far weaker in wind strength than when it swept through the Caribbean as a Cat 5 just days earlier — yet still knocked out power to 2.7 million customers.
articles.title: Just a Category 1 hurricane? Don't be fooled by a number — it could be more devastating than a Cat 5

articles.author: BY DYEPKAZAH SHIBAYAN
articles.description: ABUJA, Nigeria (AP) — A two-story school collapsed during morning classes Friday in north-central Nigeria, killing 22 students and sending rescuers on a frantic search for more than 100 people trapped in the rubble, authorities said.
articles.title: The collapse of a school in northern Nigeria leaves 22 students dead, officials say

articles.author: WAFAA SHURAFA
articles.description: DEIR AL-BALAH, Gaza Strip (AP) — Civil defense workers on Friday dug bodies out of collapsed buildings and pulled them off rubble-covered streets, as they collected dozens of Palestinians killed this week by an Israeli assault in a district of Gaza City.
articles.title: Emergency workers uncover dozens of bodies in a Gaza City district after Israeli assault

articles.author: MARCIA DUNN
articles.description: CAPE CANAVERAL, Fla. (AP) — A SpaceX rocket has failed for the first time in nearly a decade, leaving the company’s internet satellites in an orbit so low that they're doomed to fall through the atmosphere and burn up.
articles.title: SpaceX rocket accident leaves company's Starlink satellites in wrong orbit
